reviewText: I follow aviation closely, and this DVD still had many things I did not know.The segment on the US Airways landing on the Hudson river is good, although it does not have enough of the amazing Captain Sully. However, like the rest of the DVD, this segment tells you something you never knew: Sully and his co-pilot made a major screw-up: they forgot to engage the Airbus "Ditch" switch, which contributed to the faster-than-normal sinking of the plane after it pancaked on the river. You didn't know that, did you? Me, neither.The other two segments on famous air crashes and the safety improvements that resulted from them are even better. All these crashes are well-known to aviation enthusiasts, but the resulting safety improvements were mostly unknown to me. And...Did you know that there is a runway over-run in the United States an average of every 10 days? And that such over-runs account for 25% of all aviation fatalities? No, you didn't know that. Neither did I.All in all, an excellent DVD value.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a really nice DVD for aviation enthusiasts. The first part is a documentary about the US Airways A320 ditching on the Hudson river in january 2009. It includes computer animations, passengers testimonies and great unseen footage of the accident and the rescue as well as an interview with Cpt Sullenberger. If the DVD was solely composed of this documentary, it'd be already a must have. But It also includes an excelent  two-part documentary about great air crashes and how they changed air safety industry. Definitely money very well spent!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Discovery does a nice job with the post-crash documentary of this event.The bonus features into other air crashes and what has been done in the airline industry to prevent and improve safety - are worth the price of the DVD on their own!Well worth a look, and a good purchase.

reviewText: My husband and I found this very interesting.  It involves aircraft accidents as well as the reviews and changes made as a result of them.  It's well laid out, thought provoking, and worth it if you're interested in the safety evolution of commercial aircraft.

reviewText: Does an excelland job of telling the story behind the Miracle on the Hudson.  Good video of the plane in the water and coverage of the crew and passangers.  Recommended for those who have not seen it on TV.

reviewText: I'm a big fan of the airline industry and am always looking for plane crashinformation. I was disappointed in the "Hudson" coverage and was tempted to fastforward due to boredom. But the 6 crashes that were covered afterwards more thanmade up for the mediocre start. The accidents covered include TWA 800 and Delta 191.This isn't as exciting as "May Day Air Disasters" but it's still time well spent.
